OPIS: Celem głównym projektu jest poprawa wykształcenia kadr zatrudnionych w instytucjach pomocy i integracji społecznej z obszaru województw opolskiego,dolnośląskiego, lubuskiego, łódzkiego, śląskiego, małopolskiego, podkarpackiego i świętokrzyskiego poprzez specjalizację kluczowych pracowników tych instytucji w formie szkoleń z zakresu specjalizacji I stopnia w zawodzie pracownik socjalny w okresie realizacji projektu, tj. od 01.08.2018r. do 15.02.2021r.Wskaźniki rezultatów i produktów określono w pkt.3.1Wsparcie w ramach projektu będzie kierowane do kluczowych prac. instytucji pom. i integracji społ.,którzy nie korzystali ze wsparcia w postaci specjalizacji w zaw.prac. socj. w ramach proj. finansowanych ze środków PO WER. Projekt zakłada realizację 2 zadań merytorycznych:1.szkolenie/specjalizacja I stopnia w zawodzie pracownik socjalny oraz 2.egzamin.Realizacja zadania 1 odbędzie się na podst.posiadanej przez Wnioskodawcę zgody Ministra Pracy i PS -DPS.VI.51112.54.MJ/2015(21) z dnia 25.11.2015 r.na prowadzenie specjalizacji I st. w zaw. prac. soc.Wnioskodawca spełnia warunki dotyczące sposobu realizacji szkoleń określone w ustawie o pom. społ. i Rozp. MPiPS z dnia 17 kwietnia 2012r.w spr. specjalizacji w zaw. prac. socjalny,dot. w szczególności:programu szkolenia,kadry dydaktycznej, potencjału technicznego, warunków lokalowych,sanitarnych,dostępu do biblioteki, pomocy dydaktycznych,środków audiowizualnych do prowadzenia poszczególnych form zajęć,itp.Szkolenia będą realizowane zgodnie z dokumentacją dołączaną do wniosku o wydanie ww.zgody na szkolenia, potwierdzającą spełnianie ww. warunków. Działania projektu będą realizowane zgodnie z ww. ustawą i Rozporządz.Uzyskanie przez prac.socjalnego I st. specjalizacji możliwe będzie wyłącznie po spełnieniu warunków określonych w ww. Rozp.,w tym w szczególności zdanie egzaminu przed RKE. Szkol.zakończy się egzaminem na I st. specjalizacji w zaw. prac. socjalny oraz uzyskaniem dyplomu poświad. uzyskanie ww.st. specjalizacji.
TYTUL: Specjalizacja kadr zatrudnionych w instytucjach pomocy i integracji - I stopień specjalizacji w zawodzie pracownik socjalny

OPIS: The areas of the current Podkarpackie Region are a place where oil was started to be extracted and used for purposes known to us today. In the region, lived and worked - Ignacy Łukasiewicz i.a. inventor of the kerosene lamp, known all over the world. A similar heritage can be found in areas located in the Lviv Oblast, including those in the immediate vicinity of Podkarpacie. For example Łukasiewicz also worked in Lviv, where the world's first oil lamp burned. Both in the Podkarpackie Voivodeship and in the Lviv region there are places that are the cradle of the world oil industry, and are also the cradle of all modern industrialization. As in the South of the region of Podkarpacie, on the Ukrainian side, the city of Lviv, Boryslav and its surroundings play a special role in the history of the oil industry. The visibility of the rich heritage of these places is a great way to stimulate the tourism movement of the regions mentioned and to strengthen cross-border cooperation between Poles and Ukrainians. As part of the micro-project, actions would be taken to promote knowledge about oil heritage, including creating a film guide to the objects taking into account the common heritage of industrial culture related to the achievements of Ignacy Łukasiewicz in connection with the tradition of oil extraction, as well as the development of the quest (game). Partners in the initiative would be the Podkarpackie Voivodeship (LB) and the Euroregion Carpathians - Ukraine (B1), and the activities would take place in the Podkarpackie Voivodeship and Lviv Oblast. All products created as part of the project would also be used after completion of project. The project will popularize knowledge about the common oil heritage of Łukasiewicz resulting in an increase in tourism in the Podkarpackie region and the Lviv Region, and thanks to the common awareness of this heritage, cooperation in the Polish- Ukrainian border area will be strengthened.
TYTUL: Oil heritage of Ignacy Łukasiewicz's activity

OPIS: The project overall objective is the popularization of religious songs as the cultural heritage of Poland and Ukraine. The religious Polish and Ukrainian songs originating from Christian background are barely known to the public in the mainstream media. These songs were the important part of everyday life and holidays in the history of both nations. The lasting overflow of mass media music heavily hinders the promotion of cultural and religious heritage especially to the younger audience. Both Beneficiaries plan to prepare and perform religious songs for their community during the project as the mutual cultural campaign. The project will be implemented by Polish leader - Roman Catholic Parish of Blessed Virgin Mary Queen of Poland in Jarosław and Ukrainian partner - Religious Community of Roman Catholic Church of Divine Mercy Parish in Shevchenkivskyi District of Lviv City. Both parishes lead their amateur choirs which activity focuses on preparation and performance of modern and historical religious songs. The overall objective will be met by running cultural campaign 'Religious songs for all seasons', providing regular musical classes and workshops with the trainer for the choirs, organizing 8 concerts (4 in Poland and 4 in Ukraine, which will be cultural events for at least 800 participants), organizing 2 popularization meetings and a recording, releasing and distributing the album with 16 chosen religious songs. As the result of these activities, both parishes will become cultural sites. The project will be beneficial for local citizens and their respective cities and societies along with tourists visiting these places. The cross-border approach is needed to remind and reconstitute the mutual Christian and cultural origins of both nations that were united as one country for ages. The project will also be a chance for partners to take part in the important international project for the first time and boost their cultural activities.
BENEFICJENT: PARAFIA PW. NMP KRÓLOWEJ POLSKI W JAROSŁAWIU

MIEJSCE: WOJ.: Ivano-Frankivska oblast | WOJ.: Lvivska oblast | WOJ.: PODKARPACKIE | WOJ.: Zakarpatska oblast
OPIS: The concept of “Cross-border Wooden Architecture Route as a chance to preserve unique cultural heritage of Polish- Ukrainian borderland” is an answer to the actual need of preservation and popularization of wooden architecture heritage of PL-UA cross-border area, as well as increasing the attractiveness of common border area since its potential remains insufficiently exploited. Therefore, joint actions within the project are necessary for strengthening the tourist offer of the Programme area, hence encouraging tourists to visit it, what will result in an increase of tourist traffic in the region. One of the objectives is also increasing the awareness of local communities and tourists about richness and diversity of traditions of Polish-Ukrainian borderland and the need to launch social dialog in order to preserve these traditions. These goals will be achieved through such activities as: - development of new Cross-border Wooden Architecture Route - the planned number of the objects to be included in the Route - 163 (127 objects in Podkarpackie region and 36 objects in Ukrainian area), - development of e-products: 2 information websites and 12 virtual tours promoting wooden architecture, - promotional campaign (influencer marketing) dedicated to wooden architecture monuments of Polish-Ukrainian borderland, - organization of 6 cross-border cultural events and guided tours. The implementation of the project will also reduce the actual barriers in the access to valuable and attractive monuments through establishing cooperation with managers of these architectural monuments, development of a new cross-border tourist product and creation of tools that will serve information and promotion of wooden architecture in the Programme area in a long term. The final recipients of the project will be mostly inhabitants of Polish-Ukrainian borderland and tourists visiting the Programme area as well as people interested in architecture, cultural heritage and history of the region
TYTUL: Cross-border Wooden Architecture Route as a chance to preserve unique cultural heritage of Polish-Ukrainian borderland

MIEJSCE: Cały Kraj | WOJ.: Lvivska oblast | WOJ.: PODKARPACKIE
OPIS: The cultural heritage of Polish-Ukrainian borderland, including the existing historic infrastructure, is not adequately used. The Zagórz Commune and the Lion Society from Lviv will implement a project aimed at organizing historical and cultural events and thus at creating new tourist products, i.e. historical reconstructions at the Castle in Dobromil and in Zagórz. The implementation of the project will contribute to a better use of cultural and historical heritage and consequently, to the promotion of new tourist products. The genesis of the project comes from the anticipated intentions leading to the integration of activities by the partners in the field of promoting culture, as well as to the protection and preservation of cultural heritage both on Polish and on Ukrainian side. Effective promotion of the region in these aspects means, among others, proper use of its assets, including cultural and historical ones. The use of this potential is an important link in the development of cooperation within the local community, cultural cross-border cooperation between communities, with considering the promotion of local cultural heritage and its multicultural aspect. The overall objective of the project is raising the level of sustainable use of cultural and historical values by residents and tourists in the southern part of the Polish-Ukrainian border. Target groups of the project are: inhabitants of Zagórz and Dobromil areas, local authorities representatives, local and regional journalists, NGOs representatives and tourist guides. The final beneficiaries of the project are: - tourists who will visit the sites of cultural and historical heritage, i.e. the Zagórz Monastery and the Dobromil Castle, - craftsmen who produce souvenirs in the area of project implementation, - entrepreneurs conducting activities related to tourism in the area of project implementation.
TYTUL: To touch history and culture - a historical-cultural mosaic of the Polish-Ukrainian borderland

MIEJSCE: Cały Kraj | WOJ.: Lvivska oblast | WOJ.: PODKARPACKIE
OPIS: Project covers mountain districts of Lviv oblast - Skolivski Beskydy and Bieszczady Poviat, including highest mountains of Polish Beskids and picturesque San river valley and focuses on development and promotion of cultural and natural heritage in cross-border mountain territories, becoming increasingly popular for active recreation and cultural attractions. Boykos, a Ukrainian ethnographic group, inhabited territory of Skolivski Beskydy in Ukraine. For centuries Boykos resided also in Bieszczady in Poland. Forced resettlement, two world wars and migration in 20th century had irretrievably changed situation in that quiet area. Still fortunately a great number of objects that represent historical and cultural heritage (both tangible and intangible) of the region survived. Unique and diverse, they should not sink into oblivion, but be maintained and exhibited. Project aims to revive and preserve traditional Boyko cuisine while investigating and recreating culinary traditions in mountain region of Ukraine and Polish Beskids. This will increase use of mutual ethno-cultural heritage of neighboring nations, attract more visitors to the objects of natural and cultural heritage and increase diversity and quality of tourism services. Places for traditional Boyko food master classes will be arranged, master classes will be held by local masters willing to share their priceless knowledge in order to preserve and promote intangible cultural heritage. Master classes will encourage representatives of culture and tourism departments, tour operators, journalists and bloggers to put to use ancient recipes collected and tested out during project implementation. Governmental representatives strengthening cultural links and cooperation, journalists and bloggers promoting the cuisine, tour operators promoting gastronomic tours exploring little-known mountain trails in territories of Poland and Ukraine will contribute to development of tourism in cross-border areas of both countries.
TYTUL: Reproduction and preservation of culinary traditions for the promotion of culture heritage of mountainous cross-border regions

MIEJSCE: Cały Kraj | WOJ.: Ivano-Frankivska oblast | WOJ.: Lvivska oblast | WOJ.: PODKARPACKIE | WOJ.: Zakarpatska oblast
OPIS: The project to be carried out in Lviv, Transcarpathian, Ivano-Frankivsk regions in Ukraine and Podkarpackie voivodeship in Poland aimes at creation and promotion on the base of the common cultural heritage of the moutanious part of the Ukrainian-Polish border new tourist product - Carpathian Wooden Architecture Route. The project aim to address the following problems: lack of system approach to promotion and preservation of common historical and cultural heritage on the project area, lack of complex crossborder tourist products, as well as the low level of local population awareness of the significance of the heritage (esp. on the Ukrainian side). The implementation of the project will lead to the creation of common crossborder route and its promotion, as well as increasing of local population awareness concerning the management of cultural heritage. A target groups: local leaders; religious communities, tourism industry, local and regional media, representatives of local and regional governments related to the region promotion. Final beneficiaries: tourists, regional and local governments, non-governmental organizations, population of project area. The project is of a significant importance for people living in mountanious region of Polish–Ukrainian border areas and tourists. Creation and promotion of Carpathian Wooden Architecture Route will bring together local leaders; religious communities, tourism industry, regional media, representatives of local and regional governments from 4 border regions in order to impelment joint actions concerning preservation and promotion of the historical and cultural heritage. Undoubtedly, the implementation of such an ambitious plan, creating a common tourist route as a tool for the promotion of cultural heritage is impossible without joint efforts of partners on both sides of the border, representing different sectors - communities, local and regional authorities and non-governmental organizations, engaged in th
TYTUL: Carpathian Wooden Architecture Route - joint actions for preservation and promotion of the historical and cultural heritage on the Ukrainian-Polish border

MIEJSCE: WOJ.: PODKARPACKIE | WOJ.: PODKARPACKIE, POW.: lubaczowski | WOJ.: Zakarpatska oblast
OPIS: An increasing number of people are visiting churches & other religious heritage sites – awareness of their significance as attractions is growing. And the wooden sacral architecture has become the determining feature of the cultural originality of the Carpathians presenting the hidden giants of the region's tourism destinations. Besides being foremost the places of worship wooden churches are tangible expressions of the Carpathian culture evolution, local heritage, family history & tales of human events & achievements, embellished with architecture, art & craftsmanship. But these buildings are a fragile resource, non-commercial & almost entirely dependent upon voluntary effort. If they are not supported & promoted to help them open up, welcome visitors & tell their stories, a vital part of the Carpathian culture & history could be irretrievably lost. However, to utilize their great potential we still need to solve two major problems: 1) bad physical conditions & destruction of wooden churches; &, 2) unsatisfactory promotion of wooden sacral architecture objects. Towards this end, the project sets its overall objective to preserve & promote wooden sacral architecture of the Carpathians as the key objects of cultural/historical heritage & hidden giants for tourism development. By achieving its objective the project will contribute to development of church tourism in the border region, improving its image, attractiveness of small communities. In the longterm, it will contribute to social & economic development of the borderland based on tourism industry, integration of the border communities into national, cross-border & international tourism routes. Outputs to achieve this: awareness raised of wooden church maintainers, CBC established to utilize wooden churches for tourism development, information base & tools developed for promotion of wooden sacral architecture, joint promotion events held. The project will lead to increase of visitors' number to th
BENEFICJENT: AGENCY OF REGIONAL DEVELOPMENT AND CROSSBORDER COOPERATION "TRANSCARPATHIA"
TYTUL: Wooden Churches - the hidden giants of common tourism destination "Carpathians"

OPIS: The main challenge of the project is to use the potential of San and Strwiąż rivers for developing innovative tourist products in the border area based on the common natural heritage of both rivers. These products would be used as means for increasing tourist traffic. During the past decades majority of rivers in Western European countries were regulated. At the same time in Podkarpackie region and Ukraine such construction works were not that common. Nowadays the unchanged sections of San and Strwiąż rivers provide a competitive advantage to the Polish-Ukrainian border area (the area presents a huge tourist potential due to its natural character, however there is no tourist offer or it is insufficient). The ecosystems of these rivers are interconnected. The source of the San river is located in Ukraine and the source of the Strwiąż river is in Podkarpackie region in Poland. The first part of the project will involve the inventory of tourist and natural potential of the area and development of tourist products based on natural heritage of the borderland. The second part of the project will include promotion of this potential. The promotion will be focused on package offer for the tourists (developed earlier by the experts). The promotional activities will include: - 4 promotional events for tourists and media enriched with elements of niche tourism e.g. meetings with nature photography instructor, ornithologist specializing in bird-watching, ichthyologist; - printed materials such as tourist maps with attractive tourist routes proposed and described (maps will also include safety information about water tourism); - online marketing including: development of online multimedia guide with sounds of nature, video campaign and campaign in local media.
TYTUL: Sounds of nature. SlowRivers - practical package for tourists

MIEJSCE: WOJ.: Ivano-Frankivska oblast | WOJ.: Lvivska oblast | WOJ.: PODKARPACKIE | WOJ.: Zakarpatska oblast
OPIS: The main challenge of the nature protected ares of Ukrainian and Polish borderland united by ecosystem of the Carpathians is search for long-term solutions of effective use of its nature potential taking into account the environmental, socio-cultural and economic impacts. On the one hand, the territories of natural parks needs investments to develop recreation infrastructure, on the other hand, growing human pressure caused by the increasing volume of tourist traffic can be very harmful for the nature protected areas of the Carpathians. Thus development of active tourism in nature protected areas should be based on the concept of sustainability - balance of the needs of tourists visiting tourist centers, the population of the latter, and preservation of the natural environment. This project is aimed at the preserving and promotion of nature protected areas of the Carpathians through the development of sustainable tourism. It will be achieved by the means of the following cross-border activities: (1) study visit for personnel of Ukrainian national natural parks to natural parks of Poland to exchange the best practices of sustainable tourism development; (2) cross-border conference "Modern solutions for the development of active tourism in nature protected areas"; (3) creation of cross-border concept of active tourism development in natural parks that will become a base for further cooperation concerning promotion and preservation of natural heritage. The concept based on the balanced form of development that enables the environment to be preserved and, at the same time, allows its exploitation to ensure tourism and economic growth; (4) development of recreation infrastructure in pilot natural park "Skolivski Beskydy" aimed at preventing the uncontrolled and negative impact of visitors on the environment. The project activities requires cross-border partnership to sharing best practices and implementing common solutions within one ecosystem.
TYTUL: Sustainable tourism development in nature protected areas of the Carpathians

MIEJSCE: WOJ.: Ivano-Frankivska oblast | WOJ.: PODKARPACKIE | WOJ.: Zakarpatska oblast
OPIS: The Ukrainian-Polish borderland within common ecological system of the Carpathian Mountains has great variety of floraand fauna that due to the specific natural environment have morphological and behavioral features. One of the aboriginal representatives of the Carpathians nature is the Carpathian bee (also called "Carpatka"). Changing climatic conditions, use of pesticides, crossbreeding have caused the low level of purebred Carpathian bees (about 40 %). Therefore, there is a need to preserve and popularize breeding of aboriginal Carpathian bees as a part of natural heritage of the region. Another challenge is decreasing interest to the beekeeping among young people in spite of rich beekeeping traditions of the Carpathian region. Popularization of beekeeping and traditional bee-products is also required to draw attention to the problem of preservation of the Carpathian bee population. The project is aimed at the creation holistic approaches to preservation of the local aboriginal Carpathian bee breed along with promotion of the beekeeping traditions in the Carpathians. The main project outputs are: (1) cross-border events aimed at the promotion of natural heritage (honey festival in Kolochava, final conference in Kosiv, workshop in Rzeszow); (2) studying the breed composition of the high mountainous Carpathian apiaries and determining the level of variability of the breed in the context of several seasons; (3) two open area exhibitions of beehives representing history of beekeeping in the Carpathians; (4) three developed tourist routes including the main tourist locations related to history and presence of beekeeping; (5) promotional publications for attracting the visitors. The local authorities, residents of Zakarpattia and Ivano-Frankivsk regions, Podcarpackie voivodeship, tourists, scientists will benefit from the project implementation. The project activities require the cross-border partnership to sharing best practices.
BENEFICJENT: NON-GOVERNMENT ORGANIZATION ASSOCIATION OF BEEKEEPER "CARPATHIAN ECO-APIARY"
TYTUL: Carpathian bee - joint actions for preservation of unique natural heritage in Ukrainian-Polish borderland

MIEJSCE: Cały Kraj | WOJ.: Lvivska oblast | WOJ.: PODKARPACKIE
OPIS: Young Europeans want to save a common historical and cultural heritage in Sokal district and Przemysl Poviat. The project idea is to carry out the international cross-border volunteer camps "Our Common Cultural Heritage" in order to renovate historical and architectural objects in the cities of Ugniv (Ukraine) and the city of Przemysl (Poland). During 22 days, 18 volunteers from Belarus, Poland and Ukraine will work on the territory of the historical-cultural reserve, in the synagogue and in the Jewish cemetery, as well as in the Orthodox Church and the Roman Catholic churches, performing renovations. Young people will also learn the history of Western Ukraine and Eastern Poland, visit Belz, Sokal, Chervonograd, Zhovkva in Ukraine; Forts of Przemysl, Ustrzyki Gorne, Zamosc in Poland. Volunteers will meet the representatives of local authorities, residents, become participants in many practical and theoretical lessons. Before the end of camp, volunteers themselves will collect and prepare information for publications. Materials will reflect new approaches and ideas regarding the preservation of monuments and ways of raising funds (involving sponsors, donations,community forces). The creative visions of young people, the conclusions they will make during their meetings with professionals and during their work on specific sites will be reflected in printed form: tourist leaflet with information on interesting places in Sokal district and Przemysl Poviat, a brochure on the history of Ugniv and Przemysl, as well as photopresentations for local authorities, owners of tourist facilities and hotels to use freely and distribute them in order to promote the region among tourists. Mountains Guides Association "Rovin" from Lviv and Local Tourist Organization of Przemysl - the camp organizers - aim to popularize ideas of volunteering among young people and of supporting preservation of cultural and historical heritage.

MIEJSCE: WOJ.: LUBELSKIE | WOJ.: PODKARPACKIE | WOJ.: PODLASKIE | WOJ.: ŚWIĘTOKRZYSKIE
OPIS: Istotą projektu jest opracowanie innowacyjnego modelu leczenia środowiskowego, którego odbiorcą będą osoby chore psychicznie oraz z zaburzeniami psychicznymi z tzw. podwójną diagnozą. Celem główny projektu to poprawa jakości usług świadczonych na rzecz osób chorych psychicznie i z zaburzeniami psychicznymi z tzw."podwójną diagnozą" z terenu województwa lubelskiego, podkarpackiego, świętokrzyskiego i podlaskiego poprzez opracowanie do VIII 2016 r. innowacyjnego modelu leczenia środowiskowego. Grupa docelowa to użytkownicy i odbiorcy innowacji. Użytkownicy w wymiarze personalnym to : terapeuci środowiskowi Powiatowych Ośrodków Wsparcia, Środowiskowych Domów Samopomocy, Domów Pomocy Społecznej, psycholody, terapeuci instytucji integracji społecznych działający na rzecz osób chorych psychicznie i z zaburzeniami psychicznymi z tzw."podwójną diagnozą", lekarze psychiatrzy. Użytkownicy pośredni, którzy mogą w swojej pracy wykorzystać innowacyjny model to : pracownicy ośrodków pomocy społecznej, powiatowych urzędów pracy, Powiatowych Centrów Pomocy Rodzinie, kuratorzy społeczni, psychologowie pracujący w poradniach psychologiczno-pedagogicznych, asystenci rodzinni, psychologowie policyjni, nauczyciele pracujący z młodzieżą zaburzoną psychicznie i chorą psychicznie, pedagodzy szkolni. Odbiorcami innowacji będą : osoby chore psychicznie i z zaburzeniami psychicznymi z podwójną diagnozą psychiatryczną oraz ich najbliższe otoczenie ( m.in małżonkowie, rodzice, dzieci). W ramach zadań projektowych zostanie opracowany  gotowy do testowania model leczenia środowiskowego, będą przeprowadzone konsultacje modelu i zostanie zawiązane partnerstwo na rzecz deinstytucjonalizacji usług świadczonych na rzecz osób z podwójnym rozpoznaniem. Kluczowe rezultaty : wyposażenie użytkowników innowacji w nowoczesne narzędzia wspierania podopiecznych z podwójną diagnozą, osiągnięcie efektu synergii terapii medycznej i rehabilitacji społecznej, włączenie szerokiego grona
